title: Should be able to resize the client
body:
Upon downloading the alpha client I noticed that it's particularly small compared to the current client, but with the current client you are able to resize by dragging the corners of the window, however, with alpha client this isn't possible, is this to be implemented into the future?

EDIT: I keep notifications for this thread and comments about how this is in the game now, so I thought I'd edit the post to make sure everyone knows! Yes, this is in the alpha client now, you have 3 options of resolution and you can make the client bigger/smaller, it's not resizing the corners but it's still increasing/decreasing the size! 

Thank you Riot.

Hey guys, as many of you are aware we've recently added the ability to resize the client with CTRL + ^   and also added four [preset sizes](http://i.imgur.com/wURO9Jr.jpg) to the options menu. While this isn't the ideal solution, for now we believe it removes most of the pain around being able to interact with the client on different resolutions. We'll continue to work on  it as we go  into beta.

Agree 100% on this. On my main monitor the client is full screen, which is annoying as it gets buggy with my task bar being on top of the client. When I move the client to my other smaller monitor it is not full screen. Give us the option since I like to have my client  NOT be full screen when I'm waiting for people to maybe get back to their PC or what not.

Definitely agree, it makes the game feel much more immersive when I don't have to see all my messy desktop icons in the background behind the client. The ability to maximize the window would be great. I realize the old client doesn't quite have this feature and I think it works fine because it is just less cluttered itself. I can minimize the friends list, the bar at the top with the play button has lots of free space, and this helps buffer it from the surrounding desktop.

To add to this; the client needs to be able to work happily with Window Snapping. I have a a vertical monitor to my right where i resize the client to fit on the top half. It's just such a common windows thing that people/I already intuitively expect. Though I do admit that this brings more problems for the UX/User Experience designers; currently they just force the client to be at a constant aspect ratio and design around that one scenario. 

To add to what others are suggesting; I see a problems with have a fullscreen option; it implies full immersion into that program (ie. somewhat constant entertainment). I doubt any one playing league only looks at the client from open to close. In fact the client is minimalistic; it give you the information you want and that's it. There's no 3D Urgot dancing  during queue, no collection of videos/streams, nor in-game browser for anything really (ie. custom server browser, world chat, huge community chat). 

How does the UX guy deal with all the extra space when the game is fullscreened? Does the client just get bigger to fill sapce or is more space just added to elements in the design? Or does the client just get reorganized entirely when switching between fullscreen-client and minimized-client? 

There is definitely a problem with the current system, people feel constrained by the resizing options for the window; but solving that problem isn't cut and dry.
